metadata.title: CVE-2021-21143 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in Extensions in Google Chrome prior to 88.0.4324.146allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extensionto potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted Chrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
